title: Francis Heiser
text:
Francis Bernhard Heiser (died 14 December 1952) was a British Anglican priest who was principal of <a href="Fourah%20Bay%20College">Fourah Bay College</a> in <a href="Sierra%20Leone">Sierra Leone</a> before becoming principal of St Aidan's Theological College in <a href="Birkenhead">Birkenhead</a>.
Life.
Heiser was educated at <a href="Jesus%20College%2C%20Oxford">Jesus College, Oxford</a>, graduating in 1906. After being ordained in 1907, he served as <a href="curate">curate</a> of St Luke's Church, <a href="Hampstead">Hampstead</a> until 1914. He was then the incumbent of Christ Church, <a href="Madras">Madras</a> until 1920. He was principal of <a href="Fourah%20Bay%20College">Fourah Bay College</a> in <a href="Sierra%20Leone">Sierra Leone</a> from 1920 to 1922, before returning to England and becoming vice-principal of St Aidan's Theological College in <a href="Birkenhead">Birkenhead</a> in 1924. He was principal from 1929 to 1950, then became the <a href="vicar">vicar</a> of St Margaret's Church in <a href="Collier%20Street">Collier Street</a>, <a href="Kent">Kent</a>. He was appointed an honorary <a href="canon%20%28priest%29">canon</a> of <a href="Chester%20Cathedral">Chester Cathedral</a> in 1942.
